course.subject: ELEC
course.name: RF/Microwave Circuit Design and Measurement
course.description: Introduction to techniques for analyzing, engineering and testing of circuits for RF/microwave frequencies using CAD tools.  The lab provides hands-on CAD/simulation, building and testing of low-noise amplifier, mixer, VCO, filter, IF AGC, detectors and other circuits discussed in lecture.

reviews.author: Shaokang
reviews.comment_content:
This course delivers the basic ideas about microwave engineering.
Weekly lectures + Biweekly labs, introducing:
high-frequency modelling of devices (R, L, C, transistors), S parameter, matching network design using Smith Chart, microwave amplifier design, noise analysis, mixer design, oscillator design.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Weekly lectures + Biweekly labs (2 students in a group, one report for one group)
Prof. Kevin in charge of lectures, Mr. KW (Technician) in charge of labs. Both instructors are patient and willing to answer questions and give support.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is based on the lab reports, midterm and final presentation. Not very strict, depends on how much effort you put for the report writing.
reviews.comment_workload:
4 ~ 5 lab reports + 1 homework about oscillator design.
One midterm (normally covers S param, Smith Chart and stuff)
Final presentation on a given technical paper, no final report required, only need to submit presentation slides.
Midterm is easy if you understand the basic idea of S parameter and methods of impedance matching.
It could still be difficult for students without electronic circuit background.

reviews.author: lizerrr
reviews.title: good class
reviews.comment_content: class with lecture and labs. The course is about techniques for analyzing, engineering and testing of circuits for RF/microwave frequencies using CAD tools.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kevin is very professional about this topic. And the teacher for the experiment in the lab is very friendly. He can help to solve the problem in the lab.
reviews.comment_grading: The class is easy to pass, because it containing many experiment, and it is not hard to get the grades about the experiment.
reviews.comment_workload: If you finish the experiment in the class, which most of the student can do, the work load would not too big.
